channel.title: Anti-Null defective?
channel.description:
* Just read the stuff in red for short, or if your in a rush
Recently I implemented the anti-null code to my client and server class. It compiled great, fine. A couple hours later someone tried to null, and it worked they completley flooded my server with over 100+ null's. On the console it showed the I.P/Host and a number which I guess would be how many times it connected (i.e 127.0.0.1: 0001)
It didn't disconnect them, ban them, etc. anyone know how to fix this?

item.title: Anti-Null defective?
item.dc:creator: @superpersonxd superpersonxd
item.description:
@superpersonxd wrote:

jmood128:

If you want to get rid of null you will need to remove Thread Per Client, no one has made an Anti-nuller that works.

Can you be more precise, where exactly is that?

Read full topic

Anti-Null is very defective, it just takes up more space in your server.
